Name: Sangrita
Ingredients: 2 drop Hot pepper sauce (red vinegar-based e.g. Tabasco)
Instructions: SHAKE ingredients with ice and strain into shot glass. Serve with a shot of tequila. The drinker can either down the tequila and chase it with sangrita or sip the two drinks alternately.
Review: In Mexico the quality of the homemade Sangrita can make or break a bar. This recipe is spicy and slightly sweet and perfect for chasing tequila.
History: The name means 'little blood' in Spanish and the drink is served with tequila in every bar in Mexico.
